summary:
With 10 years experience in Big Data technologies and 17 years experience in development (mainly Java, but also a bit of C++) I am fully committed in developing robust secure scalable and easy to maintain applications.

I care about the product, the users and I like to have things done.

Currently working with Google Cloud technologies: BigQuery, Google Storage, Compute Engine, Dataflow, Airflow (Composer), BigTable, Functions.

education.degree_name: Ingeniería Técnica en Informática de Sistemas
Técnico Superior en Administración de Sistemas Informáticos

projects.title: Hadoop On The Road: Personal Project
projects.description:
Studying Hadoop technologies and its ecosystem in order to write the exposure blog: http://hadoopontheroad.blogspot.com. Contents of this website aims to be both theory and practical.

Installation of a Hadoop environment on a Mac computer and setup of a pseudo-distributed cluster.
Working with HDFS file system through command line and Java API.

Explaining how to create an Eclipse project for Hadoop and how to use the Hadoop plug-in for native MapReduce projects.

Developing many examples using different Hadoop features (InputFormats, SequenceFiles, WritableComparable, etc.).

Studying the ecosystem: Pig, Hive, Sqoop, Avro, etc.

courses.name: Cloudera Developer for Apache Hadoop (4 days)
Web Intelillence and Big Data (10 weeks online course on Coursera). Indian Institute of Technology Delhi

profile_positions.description:
I work on data collection, transformation and processing in order to offer to our users information as much structured as possible alongside the Ripe NCC researchers.

Currently working on a prototype moving data currently stored in HDFS and difficult to access for analytical purpose into Google Cloud in order to offer a fast and flexible access to the data to researchers.
Working BigQuery or Google Cloud Storage. And other technologies used on the prototype: Airflow (Cloud Composer), Dataflow, BigTable, Compute Engine, Google Functions, Kafka.
- Project definition and roadmap.
- Feasibility study and budget.
- Aligning stakeholders.


I am responsible of the development and maintenance of the different projects based on hadoop/big data technologies managing Internet related data (http://atlas.ripe.net and http://ris.ripe.net).

- Several clusters with more than 150 machines
- Hadoop technologies: mapreduce, pig, hbase.
- Real time consumming technologies: Kafka, RabbitMq
- Maintenance and improvement of data quality and storage.
- Migration of old pig jobs to other technologies.
- Supporting other team members and groups.
- Defining and planning new prototypes.
- Google Cloud technologies: BigQuery, Compute Engine, Storage.
- Java, Hadoop, mapreduce, pig, hbase, Kafka, Kafka streams.
profile_positions.title: Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Hadoop/Big Data Analyst in Pragsis working in internal projects.
Bidoop is a Pragsis framework with several layers to operate with BigData through the Hadoop Ecosystem with an ETL (data extraction, validation, transformation and load), an event engine (CEP) and a workflow engine for a more efficient data treatment. 
Bidoop implements multiple Hadoop Ecosystem technologies: Hbase, flume, Hive, Sqoop, MapReduce, HDFS.
Cloudera Hadoop CDH4 and CDH51
Local environment for MRUnit testing and pseudodistributed environment in a virtual machine.
Java, eclipse, maven.

3 days Spark training developing exercises with Scala.
01/08/2014 - 30/09/2014: Developing a new Event Engine with Spark technology (Scala), connecting with Hbase, and Tachyon as data persistence.
Installation and configuration of Spark and Tachyon in a 3 nodes cluster (MapR).

Since 1/10/2014: Location Tracking project. Geolocation system in real time using wifi devices and further analysis of the data (charts visualization). Developed with Spark (Java). 
Storing data in HBase and Hive.
Execution and testing in a 3 nodes cluster (Cloudera CDH5)

4 days Hadoop for Developers training.
profile_positions.title: Hadoop / Big Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Hadoop/Big Data Analyst in GFT developing scalable ETL for Deutsche Bank. 8 people team.

Hadoop Ecosystem and Big Data technologies.

Desinging and implementing the project architecture.
Map/Reduce paradigm.
Cloudera Hadoop CDH4.
Oozie, Hive
Testing and execution in a distributed cluster with 10 nodes.
Hadoop implementations as MultipleInputFormats, MultipleOutputFormats, SequenceFiles, Partitioner, Combiner, custom InputFormat and RecordReader.
Using FileSystem for the treatment of files in HDFS
MRUnit for unit testing
XML and XSLT treatment (Mapforce).
Eclipse, Java, Maven

profile_positions.description:
Finance and Insurance Sector. 20 people team.  
Computer services for the management of credit defaults and recoveries.
	10/2010 - 09/2012: 4ª Línea Project: 
System for managing payments and defaults among companies: Management and recoveries.
The project consists of severan sub-projects:
10/2010 – 10/2011: Informa con Recobro (Report to recovery): Project in collaboration with Informa D&B to attract customers.. 
Analysis, developpment and documentation. 
	Java/J2EE, JSF (RichFaces), Hibernate, hql, Spring, WebServices Axis (client and server), eclipse, TomCat 6.
10/2011 - 09/2012: Gestión de Cobros (Collection Management): Development for CESCE (company of the group) of the new application for managing defaults. 
Analysis, functional definition, development. 
Writing documentation.
	Java, J2EE, Flex (Action Script), spring, hibernate, hql, eclipse, TomCat 6, Toad.

	06/2010 – 10/2010: Project for San Andrés de Negocios costumer:
Application for managing business transactions and administrative tasks for a major food company.
Project evolutionary and corrective.
Analysis and development according to costumer specifications. 
Java/J2EE, JSP, struts, PL/Sql, Sql, eclipse, TomCat 6, oracle 9.
